claim: Hydroxychloroquine cures Covid-19.
text: The Mayo Clinic “quietly” updated its website in 2023 to say that hydroxychloroquine can now be used to treat COVID-19.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Posts mislead on Mayo Clinic's hydroxychloroquine webpage
claimReview.textualRating: False. A page about hydroxychloroquine on the hospital system’s website included outdated guidance that the malaria drug “may also be used to treat coronavirus (COVID-19) in certain hospitalized patients.” But archives show the text has been there since at least May 2020, a month before the U.S. Food and Drug Administration revoked its emergency approval for using the drug to treat COVID. After the Mayo Clinic page circulated widely in recent days, the organization took the page down and clarified that it does not endorse the use of hydroxychloroquine for treating COVID-19 patients.

claim: Coronavirus Vaccine has been created in Israel
text: The newest Israeli data on COVID-19 infections indicate a complete vaccine failure on every level. The data from Israel shows that nearly all serious cases and deaths are among the vaccinated.
label: Not Enough Information

claimReview.title: Posts mislead on Israel vaccine data
claimReview.textualRating: Missing context. The claim ignores the fact that Israel has only a fraction of the COVID-19 cases that it had in January, before vaccines were widespread. Furthermore, the majority of adults in Israel are now vaccinated with two Pfizer shots. No vaccine is perfect at preventing breakthrough cases, but the data shows vaccines are reducing the number of people who are severely ill, hospitalized or die from the virus.

claimReview.title: There's not enough evidence to say it's as easy to buy drugs as ...
claimReview.textualRating: There is not enough evidence for this claim, which does not appear in the review itself. claimReview.title: Have 200000 nurses quit the NHS? – Full Fact - Health
claimReview.textualRating: This figure covers all nurses and health visitors who have left the NHS in England in the last eight years, including those with an unknown reason for leaving as well as those who have retired or died in service. Overall the number of nurses working in the NHS is slightly higher than in 2010.

claim: Over 200,000 NHS nurses have resigned since 2010.
text: Over 200,000 nurses have resigned since 2010.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Claim about social care spending and nurse numbers needs more ...
claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. This figure covers all nurses and health visitors who have left the NHS in England from 2010 to 2018, including those with an unknown reason for leaving as well as those who have retired or died in service. Overall the number of nurses working in the NHS is higher than in 2010.

claim: Over 200,000 NHS nurses have resigned since 2010.
text: Social care has been slashed by £7.7 billion since 2010.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Claim about social care spending and nurse numbers needs more ...
claimReview.textualRating: This figure refers to the savings councils in England report having had to make since 2010 on adult social care spending—through things like efficiency measures, renegotiating contracts, innovation, reducing and stopping services. It’s not the amount their budgets were reduced by, which have fallen by much less.

claim: Flu shots contain Thimerosal which may have neurological effect and cause development deficits and has been known to cause seizures.
text: The flu jab contains thimerosal, which may have neurological effects, cause developmental deficits and has been known to cause seizures.
label: Not Enough Information

claimReview.title: Image on flu jab ingredients is misleading – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: No current UK flu jabs contain thimerosal (known as thiomersal in the UK). It was removed from most UK jabs as a precaution, and doesn’t seem to build up in the human body and cause issues.

claim: Flu shots contain Thimerosal which may have neurological effect and cause development deficits and has been known to cause seizures.
text: Flu shots contain polysorbate 80, which has been linked to ovarian damage and infertility. It could induce liver failure.
label: Not Enough Information

claimReview.title: Image on flu jab ingredients is misleading – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: At least one UK flu vaccine does contain polysorbate 80. There’s no evidence that the levels found in vaccines can damage fertility or the liver.

claim: Flu shots contain Thimerosal which may have neurological effect and cause development deficits and has been known to cause seizures.
text: The flu jab contains formaldehyde, which is a human carcinogen and has been known to cause infertility and hormone imbalance.
label: Not Enough Information

claimReview.title: Image on flu jab ingredients is misleading – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Traces of formaldehyde may be in some flu vaccines if it’s used in the manufacturing process. But there’s not enough for it to be carcinogenic or affect fertility—studies linking these things look at people who handle it regularly as part of their jobs.

claim: Flu shots contain Thimerosal which may have neurological effect and cause development deficits and has been known to cause seizures.
text: The flu shot contains hydrocortisone, which may cause bone weakness, adrenal fatigue, weight gain and diabetes.
label: Not Enough Information

claimReview.title: Image on flu jab ingredients is misleading – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Two UK flu vaccines are made using hydrocortisone, so there may be traces of it in the final product. The problems listed here are potentially side effects of taking actual hydrocortisone tablets over the long term.

claim: Congressional benefits include retirement package.
text: Politicians receive full-pay retirement benefits even after serving only one term.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: Members of Congress do not receive their full pay upon retirement
claimReview.textualRating: False. Under federal law, members of Congress do not receive their full pay when they retire, and they must serve at least five years to be entitled to a pension.

claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. Growth in overall life expectancy has slowed down and almost stopped after over a century of increases. Life expectancies are falling in certain local authorities within the UK.

text: People born poor will die nine years earlier than others.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Life expectancy and poverty – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is partially correct. Boys born in some of the poorest areas in the UK are expected to live nine years fewer than those in the very richest areas. For girls the figure is seven years.

claim: Life expectancy in the UK is falling
text: Men in Teesside have the same life expectancy as those in Ethiopia.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Alex Cunningham and Boris Johnson both used the wrong figures ...
claimReview.textualRating: Men in one very deprived ward of Stockton have the same life expectancy as men in Ethiopia, according to figures from the World Bank in 2017. This isn’t the case for Teesside as a whole.

claim: Life expectancy in the UK is falling
text: Men in Uxbridge and South Ruislip live 14 years longer than they do in Stockton North.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Alex Cunningham and Boris Johnson both used the wrong figures ...
claimReview.textualRating: Men in one very deprived ward of Stockton have an average life expectancy of 64. Most men in Stockton North have a much longer life expectancy, however. The figure for Uxbridge and South Ruislip is for the London borough of Hillingdon as a whole, which is 80.

claim: Life expectancy in the UK is falling
text: The gap in UK life expectancies is falling.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Alex Cunningham and Boris Johnson both used the wrong figures ...
claimReview.textualRating: Not true. The life expectancy gap between rich and poor, and between the northeast and London, is rising.

claim: Poland has had no terror attacks.
text: A map shows that Poland has not been the target of any terror attacks, the lack of which is a result of the country’s “strict no-migrants policy.”
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Posts misrepresent data on terrorism and migration in Poland
claimReview.textualRating: False. The map, built by the Center for Strategic and International Studies using the University of Maryland’s Global Terrorism Database, only includes terror attacks from 2012 through 2015. While the database does not have records of any terror attacks in Poland during that period, it shows there have been 42 from 1971 through 2020. Additionally, Poland is open to migrants as a member of the European Union. Regardless, the map does not prove migrants are the cause of the attacks in neighboring countries, and experts say the data shows they are in fact more likely to be victims of terror than perpetrators.

claim: There is no human-caused climate change
text: Climate change is not happening, nor are humans causing significant global warming. There is also no scientific consensus that climate change is occurring.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: Old video of Weather Channel co-founder fuels climate misinfo
claimReview.textualRating: False. The scientific consensus is that climate change is real and that greenhouse gas emissions caused by human activity are driving climate change, as The Associated Press has previously reported. The false claims stem from a years-old CNN interview with John Coleman, the now deceased co-founder of The Weather Channel. At the time, he had not worked at the network in three decades, and The Weather Channel rejected his claims in the same CNN segment.

label: Refuted

claim: There is no human-caused climate change
text: NASA admitted that climate change is due to the Earth’s orbit around the sun, not greenhouse gas emissions.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: NASA did not attribute climate change to the Earth's orbit
claimReview.textualRating: False. NASA has not made such a determination, a spokesperson for the agency told The Associated Press. The agency agrees with the scientific consensus that climate change is driven by greenhouse gas emissions caused by human activity.

claimReview.title: Emmanuel Macron hasn't said the UK must join the Euro if it wants to ...

claimReview.textualRating: He hasn’t said this. Under the terms of the Brexit withdrawal agreement, we’ll pay the EU an estimated £39 billion “divorce bill” for outstanding commitments and liabilities. If we remain in the EU, we would pay our membership fee each year which would cover all these things.

claim: Labour’s manifesto would have cost half of HS2.
text: Labour’s manifesto would have cost half of HS2.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: HS2 isn't expected to cost as much as this post claims – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Labour’s 2019 manifesto set aside £83 billion of additional day-to-day spending by 2023, and there were other costs not included in the manifesto. This is much more than half the current estimated cost of HS2, which is the sum of many years' spending anyway.

claim: Labour’s manifesto would have cost half of HS2.
text: HS2 will cost £150 billion.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: HS2 isn't expected to cost as much as this post claims – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is much higher than the latest independent estimate, which puts it at £106 billion. That cost is significantly higher than initital estimates.

claim: Labour’s manifesto would have cost half of HS2.
text: HS2 will cut journey times to London by a few minutes for a few people.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: HS2 isn't expected to cost as much as this post claims – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Official estimates suggest journey times will be cut more significantly, and currently forecast 300,000 passengers a day, although this is an uncertain figure.

claim: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
text: Between 1995 and 2011, EU immigrants contributed £8.8 billion more than they gained.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s an estimate from a 2013 study. There are lots of ways to calculate economic impact of immigration and no single correct answer to that question.

claim: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
text: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is based on an out-of-date estimate. A more recent estimate puts the number at just under five million.

claim: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
text: 26% of NHS doctors are foreign-born.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: 26% of doctors in England (excluding GPs) were nationalities other than British as of September 2017. The latest figure is 27% (September 2018). We don’t know where they were born as this data isn’t collected.

claim: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
text: Immigrants are 60% less likely to claim benefits than a British-born person.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s based on a decade-old report and only looked at immigrants from a few EU countries. Immigrants are probably less likely to be receiving out of work benefits than UK nationals, based on the best available evidence.

claim: Almost 5.5 million British people live permanently abroad.
text: Most studies suggest that immigration has no significant effect on overall employment, or British unemployment.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: That’s a fair general reflection of UK research. Most studies show little or no effect on employment or unemployment of UK-born workers, but it can depend on the state of the economy.

Jeremy Corbyn

claim:

claimReview.textualRating: We could find no source for this figure. A 2013 average of 88 alcohol-related deaths a month in Ireland includes a number of different factors, such as the coroner mentioning alcohol dependency, certain alcohol-related diseases, and if they were an alcoholic.

claimReview.title: More context is needed for these “facts about immigration” – Full Fact

claimReview.textualRating: Incorrect. There is no patent to the new coronavirus discovered recently in Wuhan.

claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.
text: A no deal Brexit means we wouldn’t have to make any more annual payments of £26 billion to £32 billion.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
If we leave the EU without a deal, it’s uncertain how much we’d have to pay the EU, if anything. But suggesting that we pay £26 billion to £32 billion per year at the moment is incorrect. 

Between 2011 and 2017 our net public contribution to the EU budget ranged from £8 billion to £11 billion per year.

claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.
text: A no deal Brexit means the UK makes its own laws again.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
If we leave the EU with no deal, EU laws will no longer have power or jurisdiction over the UK (although all existing EU law will be copied over into UK law).

However the UK will still follow certain international rules and regulations, such as trading rules determined by the WTO and the European Convention of Human Rights.

claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.
text: A no deal Brexit means we would have free trade with the world.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: The UK could import goods and services freely following a no-deal Brexit. But its exports would still be subject to other countries’ import regulations.

claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.

label: Supported

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating:
Under the withdrawal deal we have to pay the EU an estimated bill of £39 billion. 

With no deal, it’s uncertain how much of that we’d have to pay, if anything.

claim: A no deal Brexit means UK fishing waters are back in our control.
text: A no deal Brexit means no more ECJ or ECHR.
label: Supported

claimReview.title: What does a “WTO rules” Brexit look like? – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: It’s correct that no deal would remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice. But it’s incorrect to say it would remove the jurisdiction of the European Court of Human Rights (which has nothing to do with the EU).

claim: HS2 will cost £150 billion.
text: Labour’s manifesto would have cost half of HS2.
label: Refuted

claimReview.title: HS2 isn't expected to cost as much as this post claims – Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Labour’s 2019 manifesto set aside £83 billion of additional day-to-day spending by 2023, and there were other costs not included in the manifesto. This is much more than half the current estimated cost of HS2, which is the sum of many years' spending anyway.
